resources.string: Password Must Contain At Least One Number
Date range must be at least 28 days
Select Start Date and End Date of Program
Enter Code That Sent To Your Email
Phone Number Must Contains Minimum 10 Numbers
Protein deficiency can lead to malnutrition, impaired muscle and immune function, and developmental issues, with severe cases like kwashiorkor and marasmus affecting children.
Excessive protein intake can overburden the kidneys, increase osteoporosis risk due to calcium imbalance, and cause nutritional imbalances.
It is crucial to maintain a balanced protein intake with other nutrients to prevent health issues caused by dietary imbalances.
Low carbohydrate diets have the effect of slowing metabolism, accumulating fat storage and increasing the risk of fatigue, dehydration and muscle pain.
Excessive consumption of refined carbohydrates causes metabolic syndrome, a condition of increased blood sugar levels, high blood pressure, obesity, and increased levels of fat in the blood.
Insufficient calorie intake can lead to energy deficiency, weight loss, muscle depletion, slowed metabolism, nutrient deficiencies.
Long term consumption of high calorie diet produces obesity, initiates oxidative stress, and initiates neuroinflammation causing early onset of visceral and brain diseases.
Fat deficiency can lead to decreased energy availability, protein catabolism, weight loss, impaired growth, and skin abnormalities.
Excess fat can lead obesity, increase cholesterol in the blood, and damage arteries, increasing the risk of cardiovascular disease, hypertension, diabetes, and problems with the brain and kidneys.
